definition: to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Google offers street views and satellite imagery of homes.
sentences.chinese: 谷歌提供街景鳥瞰和住家的衛星圖像。

sentences.english: For these reasons I would support the building of a movie theater in my neighborhood.
sentences.chinese: 基於這些理由，我贊成在我的住家附近興建電影院。

sentences.english: This home is a 1930’s colonial Hawaiian home.
sentences.chinese: 這是1930年代具有殖民地特色的夏威夷住家。

sentences.english: A friend of mine spent a year as a live-in nanny, or au pair, in Paris.
sentences.chinese: 我有個朋友曾在巴黎做過一年的住家保姆。

sentences.english: My house has been hedged off.
sentences.chinese: 我的住家已用樹籬圍了起來。

sentences.english: In America, suburban homes have bigger and spookier lawn displays each year.
sentences.chinese: 在美國，郊區住家每年都會在裝飾草坪上大費苦心。

sentences.english: Home-style foreign teachers please see the specific process.
sentences.chinese: 查看請住家式外教的具體流程。

sentences.english: Or maybe a bike ride around the block tomorrow?
sentences.chinese: 亦或是明天騎腳踏車在住家附近兜兜風？

sentences.english: Some people owned two-storey houses with the ground floor used as shop and the second floor for living or storing.
sentences.chinese: 也有的是一樓一底，樓下爲店，樓上住家或堆放貨物。

sentences.english: Staying here just like acting in theater every day.
sentences.chinese: 呆在這個住家家裏表示天天想在演臺劇一樣。

sentences.english: But even the home phone number was the same.
sentences.chinese: 不過兩人的住家電話則都一樣。

sentences.english: Looking for an experienced live-in nanny to look after our one-year-old.
sentences.chinese: 誠聘一位有經驗的住家褓姆來照顧我們一歲大的孩子。

sentences.english: Two rooms one hall, double room facing south, daylighting is good, suitable for office, home.
sentences.chinese: 兩室一廳，雙室朝南，採光好，適宜辦公，住家。

sentences.english: There are no pavements. Homes and shops abut the narrow alleyways.
sentences.chinese: 路邊沒有人行道，狹窄的巷子裏住家和店鋪擠在一起。

sentences.english: Therefore, I would support a proposal to build a new movie theater in my neighborhood.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我贊成在住家附近興建一家新電影院的提議。

sentences.english: Ihave written home four times since Icame here.
sentences.chinese: 自從我到這裏來，我住家寫了四封信。

definition: (of a landlord) to rent out one or more parts of a property/(of a tenant) to sublet one or more parts of a property/(agriculture) sharecropping
to rent jointly with other people/co-renting
one bedroom and one living room
to hire/to rent/to charter/to rent out/to lease out/rent/land tax
rent for a room or house
